articles.headline: Justice Breyer to Retire From Supreme Court
articles.snippet: The decision gives President Biden a window to fulfill a campaign pledge to nominate a Black woman to the court.
articles.abstract: The decision gives President Biden a window to fulfill a campaign pledge to nominate a Black woman to the court.
articles.lead_paragraph: Follow live coverage on Stephen Breyer’s retirement from the Supreme Court.

articles.headline: Fed Signals Rate Increase in March, Citing Inflation and Strong Job Market
articles.snippet: Jerome H. Powell, the Fed chair, said the central bank could raise rates imminently as officials cut back help for the economy.
articles.abstract: Jerome H. Powell, the Fed chair, said the central bank could raise rates imminently as officials cut back help for the economy.
articles.lead_paragraph: Federal Reserve officials signaled on Wednesday that they were on track to raise interest rates in March, given that inflation has been running far above policymakers’ target and that labor market data suggests employees are in short supply.

articles.headline: Democrats Renew Push to Pass Industrial Policy Bill to Counter China
articles.snippet: A major competitiveness bill passed the Senate last year with bipartisan support, only to stall. Democrats hope to revive it in the House, but first they will have to bridge big differences.
articles.abstract: A major competitiveness bill passed the Senate last year with bipartisan support, only to stall. Democrats hope to revive it in the House, but first they will have to bridge big differences.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Biden administration officials and Democrats in Congress are pushing to revive stalled legislation that would pour billions of dollars into scientific research and development and shore up domestic manufacturing, amid deep differences on Capitol Hill about the best way to counter China and confront persistent supply chain woes.

articles.headline: Biden Expected to Nominate a Black Woman to the Supreme Court
articles.snippet: The president’s promise highlights a group that has struggled to become part of the very small pool of elite judges in the nation’s higher federal courts.
articles.abstract: The president’s promise highlights a group that has struggled to become part of the very small pool of elite judges in the nation’s higher federal courts.
articles.lead_paragraph: Follow live coverage on Stephen Breyer’s retirement from the Supreme Court.
articles.byline: By Michael D. Shear and Charlie Savage

articles.headline: Russia’s Military, Once Creaky, Is Modern and Lethal
articles.snippet: A significantly upgraded military has emerged as a key tool of Vladimir Putin’s foreign policy, as he flexes his might around the globe and, most ominously, on the Ukraine border.
articles.abstract: A significantly upgraded military has emerged as a key tool of Vladimir Putin’s foreign policy, as he flexes his might around the globe and, most ominously, on the Ukraine border.
articles.lead_paragraph: Follow the latest coverage of the Russia-Ukraine crisis.
articles.byline: By Anton Troianovski, Michael Schwirtz and Andrew E. Kramer

articles.headline: It’s Hard to Tell When the Crypto Bubble Will Burst, or If There Is One
articles.snippet: Crypto prices are highly volatile, as this week’s sell-off showed. But die-hard enthusiasts believe prices will keep soaring in a world where traditional notions of value don’t apply.
articles.abstract: Crypto prices are highly volatile, as this week’s sell-off showed. But die-hard enthusiasts believe prices will keep soaring in a world where traditional notions of value don’t apply.
articles.lead_paragraph: Since late November, some of the world’s savviest cryptocurrency investors have been hooked on a game that has cartoon sheep, cartoon wolves, a digital currency called $wool — and the potential to make real money.
articles.byline: By Emily Flitter and Karl Russell

articles.headline: U.S. Economy Grew 1.7% in 4th Quarter, Capping a Strong Year
articles.snippet: The overall 2021 increase in the gross domestic product was the biggest in decades as the pandemic’s effects eased, though challenges persist.
articles.abstract: The overall 2021 increase in the gross domestic product was the biggest in decades as the pandemic’s effects eased, though challenges persist.
articles.lead_paragraph: The U.S. economy ended last year with a flourish as consumer spending and business investment helped loosen the pandemic’s stubborn grip.

articles.headline: Biden plans to name Breyer’s successor by the end of February.
articles.snippet: Speaking with Justice Stephen Breyer by his side, Mr. Biden hailed his decades on the federal bench, including almost 28 years on the Supreme Court.
articles.abstract: Speaking with Justice Stephen Breyer by his side, Mr. Biden hailed his decades on the federal bench, including almost 28 years on the Supreme Court.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Biden said on Thursday that he would name a successor for Justice Stephen G. Breyer by the end of February, calling the retiring jurist “a model public servant in a time of great division” and pledging to take what he called the overdue step of putting a Black woman on the court for the first time in its 232-year history.
